intro: Habenaria langenheimii, commonly known as the Langenheim's orchid, is a terrestrial orchid species native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers with intricate patterns, typically blooming in late spring or early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
